lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/XiaoMe/XiaoMe.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
XiaoMe - Your personal task manager bot!

XiaoMe is a Command Line Interface (CLI) chatbot designed to help you manage your tasks efficiently. It allows users to add, list, and manipulate tasks via simple text commands, while providing a user-friendly experience with helpful prompts and feedback.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 installed on your computer.
3. Copy the `.jar` file to your desired directory.
4. Open a terminal, navigate to the directory, and run the application with:
5. You will see a welcome message like below:
What can I do for you?
6. Start interacting with XiaoMe by typing in commands such as `list`, or `todo`.
Adds a new to-do task to your task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a new deadline task with a specified due date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a new event with a specified start and end time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks currently in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks the specified task as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks the specified task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Finds a specified task from the list by searching for a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Deletes the specified task from the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Task data are automatically saved everytime a task is added, deleted, or modified.
There is no need to save manually.
Advanced users are welcome to update data directly by editing the data file.
Caution: If the changes to the data file makes its format invalid, XiaoMe will discard all data and start with an
empty data file at the next run.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user input
* Parses the user input and returns the appropriate Command object.
* If the command is unrecognized, an InvalidCommand object is returned.
* @param userInput the input string from the user
* @return the corresponding Command object based on user input
// checks what kind of command was received by XiaoMe
* The Storage class is responsible for saving and loading tasks from a file.
* Saves the given list of tasks to the specified file.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save
* @throws XiaoMeException if an error occurs while saving the file
public static void saveFile(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws XiaoMeException {
// opening a file using FileWriter automatically overwrites its preexisting content
throw new XiaoMeException("An error occurred while saving file.");
* Reads tasks from the specified file and returns them as an ArrayList.
* If the file does not exist, a new file is created.
* @return an ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file
* @throws XiaoMeException if an error occurs while reading the file
throw new XiaoMeException("File data is corrupted");
throw new XiaoMeException("File data is corrupted");
* Represents the user interface for the application.
* It handles user input and output.
* Constructs a UI object that initializes the Scanner for user input.
* Reads a command input from the user.
* @return the command input as a String
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
* Displays a horizontal line for better visual separation in the output.
* Prints the given command input to the user with surrounding lines for emphasis.
* @param commandInput the input to display to the user
* The main class for the XiaoMe task management application.
* It initializes the user interface, task storage, and handles the main application logic.
* The main method to run the XiaoMe application.
* @throws XiaoMeException if an error occurs during initialization
public static void main(String[] args) throws XiaoMeException {

* and loads tasks from the storage.

* Constructs a XiaoMeException with the specified error message.
* @param error the error message that describes the issue
* Retrieves the error message associated with this exception.
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* The {@code ByeCommand} is used when the user wants to terminate the application.
* It always returns a success message and sets the exit flag.
public final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!";

* Represents a command that adds a new deadline task to the task list.

* @param userInput the user input in the format 'deadline <description> /by <due_date>'

* @param tasks the list of tasks where the new deadline task will be added
* @return a success message with details of the newly added task
* @throws XiaoMeException if the user input format is invalid
